user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_mkfs:
```c
int32 OS_mkfs(char *address, const char *devname, const char *volname, size_t blocksize, osal_blockcount_t numblocks)
{
    int32 return_code;

    return_code = OS_FileSys_Initialize(address, devname, volname, blocksize, numblocks, true);

    if (return_code == OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE || return_code == OS_ERR_NO_FREE_IDS)
    {
        /*
         * This is the historic filesystem-specific error code generated when
         * attempting to mkfs()/initfs() on a filesystem that was
         * already initialized, or if there were no free slots in the table.
         *
         * This code preserved just in case application code was checking for it.
         */
        return_code = OS_FS_ERR_DEVICE_NOT_FREE;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No function parameter is modified in this code. There are no assignments to any parameter (no statements like address = ..., devname = ..., or volname = ...), no increments/decrements, and none of the parameters’ addresses are passed to another function (e.g. &address) that could allow modification of the pointer variable itself. The call OS_FileSys_Initialize(address, devname, volname, ...) passes the pointer values by value — that may allow the callee to modify the objects pointed to (which is permitted), but it cannot change the pointer variables of OS_mkfs. Additionally, devname and volname are const char * (so their pointees should not be modified), and return_code is a local variable. Therefore there are no fragments in this function that appear to violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
